title: Senior .NET Developer Job at Tek Experts
content:
Tek Experts provides the services of a uniquely passionate and expert workforce that takes intense pride in helping companies manage their business operations. We care about the work we do, the companies we partner with and the customers they serve.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Senior .NET Developer

Job ID: 2025-16479
Job Location: Victoria Island, Lagos
Job Type: Full-time
Category: Information Technology

Responsibilities
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Develop IT software solutions including APIs and microservices
	Participate in and support the Agile framework roles of planning, programming, testing, and analysis
	Provide ongoing level 2 support for IT software solutions
	Participate in technical workshops and learning sessions with IT support stakeholders to ensure the continued stability and availability of developed software solutions
	Define and implement detailed specifications in line with business requirements as informed by company and client needs
	Troubleshoot obstacles and errors quickly and effectively in a scalable fashion
	Actively seek out and implement improvements to process and development practices
	Fulfill additional tasks as required by direct management


Qualifications


	Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or another related field
	At least 4 years of direct programming experience
	Must have completed the compulsory 1-year NYSC or have an exemption certificate
	Deep understanding of the software development lifecycle
	Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
	Excellent organizational skills as well as an ability to manage, prioritize, and execute multiple projects simultaneously and to a deadline
	Proven success as a .NET developer
	Comprehensive understanding of the ASP.NET framework, SQL server, and design/architectural patterns (e.g., CLEAN Architecture) and grasp of different architecture styles/APIs including REST and RPC
	Experience in the finance or fintech sector is a plus
	Excellent communication skills and impeccable attention to detail
	Professional fluency in English is vital, both written and spoken.


Why You’ll Enjoy It Here


	Be Part of Something Big – A growing company where your contributions matter.
	Make an Immediate Impact – Support groundbreaking technologies with real-world results.
	Work on Cutting-Edge Tech – AI, cybersecurity, and next-gen digital solutions.
	Thrive in an Inclusive Team – A culture built on trust, collaboration, and respect.
	We Care – Integrity, empathy, and purpose guide every decision.
    

    

        Click here to Apply

title: Network Engineer Job at Presto integrated Solutions
content:
Presto integrated Solutions is an information technology development company reputed for its service excellence in contemporary design and implementation of IT based solutions for our everyday needs; from the public/government setting, educational institutions, academic terrains, NGOs, corporate entities, right down to individuals.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Network Engineer
Job Location: Ibadan, Oyo
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We are seeking a talented and experienced Network Engineer with a strong background in MikroTik equipment to join our team.
	As a Network Engineer, you will be responsible for designing, implementing, and maintaining network infrastructures that utilize MikroTik devices.
	Your expertise in MikroTik equipment will be crucial in ensuring the efficient and secure operation of our clients' networks


Responsibilities


	Design, configure, and deploy network solutions using MikroTik routers, switches, and wireless devices.
	Install and maintain MikroTik RouterOS and related software on network devices.
	Conduct network assessments and provide recommendations for network optimizations and improvements.
	Stay up-to-date with the latest trends and advancements in MikroTik technologies, and assess their suitability for implementation within our clients' networks.
	Provide technical expertise and guidance to clients and internal teams regarding MikroTik equipment and network configurations.
	Troubleshoot and resolve networking and connectivity issues related to MikroTik devices.
	Monitor network performance and proactively identify potential bottlenecks or vulnerabilities.
	Collaborate with cross-functional teams, such as software developers and system administrators, to ensure seamless integration of MikroTik equipment within larger network infrastructures.
	Document network designs, configurations, and troubleshooting procedures for future reference.


Requirements


	Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field (or equivalent work experience).
	Proven experience as a Network Engineer, specifically working with MikroTik equipment.
	In-depth knowledge of MikroTik RouterOS and associated networking protocols (e.g., OSPF, BGP, VLANs).
	Strong understanding of network security principles and best practices pertaining to MikroTik devices.
	Experience in designing and implementing complex network infrastructure projects.
	Excellent problem-solving and troubleshooting skills.
	Strong communication and interpersonal skills to effectively collaborate with clients and internal teams.
	Industry certifications, such as MikroTik Certified Network Associate (MTCNA) or MikroTik Certified Routing Engineer (MTCRE), are highly desirable.
	Familiarity with other networking technologies and equipment (Cisco, Juniper, etc.) is a plus.
	If you are a skilled Network Engineer with expertise in MikroTik equipment and are passionate about building robust and secure network infrastructures, we would love to hear from you. Join our dynamic team and contribute to delivering exceptional network solutions to our valued clients.


Salary
N90,000 - N100,000 per month. 

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and Cover Letter to: prestonigeria@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

Note: For more enquires, text; 07051336668.    

    

        Click here to Apply  
        

    
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});

title: Administrative Officer Job at Chelis Bookazine Limited
content:
Chelis Bookazine Limited is Nigeria’s leading educational supplier, supplying top quality international educational books, resources and services to Nigeria’s education industry. Chelis has completely revolutionized the school supply industry in Nigeria because of the passion, creativity, total commitment and dedication we bring into our business to achieve our vision of contributing significantly to the provision of top quality, world class education in Nigeria.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Administrative Officer 

Job Location: Lekki, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Your role will encompass managing administrative tasks, handling financial transactions, and ensuring regulatory compliance.


Requirements


	B.Sc. Degree / HND in Accounting, Business Administration, or a related field
	Minimum of 2 years of post NYSC work experience in administrative and accounting roles
	Proficiency in accounting software and Microsoft Office suite
	Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment
	Driving skill with a valid driving license
	Strong attention to detail and accuracy in financial data management
	Excellent organizational and multitasking abilities
	Close proximity or within reasonable commuting distance to Lekki phase 1 Admiralty Road is a plus
	The position entails working two Saturdays per month.


Salary
N110,000 - N130,000 Monthly.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their application and detailed CV to: chelisrecruitment@gmail.com using "Admin Officer - Lekki" as the subject of the mail.    

    

        Click here to Apply

title: IT Officer Job at Interrand Group
content:
Interrand Group is a group of companies registered and incorporated with the Corporate Affairs Commission with over the years’ experience in the fields of Construction, Engineering, Real Estate Development, Infrastructure, Property management / Consultancy and Facilities management. Interrand Engineering Ltd and Interrand Homes and Properties Ltd are the key players in the development of a large well well-balanced property portfolio ranging from residential, commercial and mixed-use properties across Nigeria. Our primary aim is to provide affordable luxury homes to our numerous valued and esteemed clients in Nigeria and the diaspora by acquiring genuine and suitable lands, designing and building functional and livable houses.
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: IT Officer

Job Location: Gudu, Abuja (FCT)
Employment Type: Full-time

job Summary


	We are seeking a proactive and skilled IT Officer to join our team. The successful candidate will be responsible for managing and maintaining the organization's IT infrastructure, providing technical support, and ensuring the smooth operation of all computer systems and networks.


Responsibilities


	Install, configure, and maintain hardware, software, and network systems.
	Provide technical support to staff on IT-related issues (onsite and remote).
	Ensure data backup, recovery, and security measures are in place.
	Troubleshoot and resolve system and network problems efficiently.
	Monitor system performance and maintain IT documentation.
	Coordinate with vendors for procurement and maintenance of IT assets.
	Ensure all systems and software are up-to-date with the latest patches and updates.
	Support in setting up workstations, email accounts, and user access control.
	Support the marketing team with digital tools such as websites, email systems, and cloud storage.
	Maintain hardware (computers, printers, routers) and ensure smooth functioning of all systems.
	Manage and troubleshoot real estate software platforms, listing tools, and CRM systems.
	Ensure cybersecurity protocols are followed to protect company data and client information.
	Perform regular data backups and disaster recovery processes.
	Oversee internet connectivity and troubleshoot network issues.
	Liaise with external IT vendors for maintenance, upgrades, and purchases.


Requirements


	Diploma or Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field.
	Minimum 2 years of experience in IT support or network administration.
	Strong understanding of Windows OS, networking, and cloud-based tools (e.g., Microsoft 365, Google Workspace).
	Experience with real estate CRMs, listing portals, or ERP software is a strong advantage.
	Knowledge of basic website maintenance and digital marketing tools is a plus.
	Strong troubleshooting, communication, and interpersonal skills.
	Strong knowledge of Windows and/or Linux operating systems, networking, and troubleshooting.
	Familiarity with firewalls, antivirus, and cybersecurity practices.
	Excellent communication and problem-solving skills.


Preferred Certifications:


	CompTIA A+ / Network+
	Microsoft Certified: Modern Desktop Administrator or similar
	Basic knowledge of digital security tools.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and Cover Letter to: hr@interrandgroup.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.    

    

        Click here to Apply
